                                Higher level


                                  Paper 3

préparation à l’enseignement supérieur, des fournisseurs de services de planification des programmes d’études, des gestionnaires de
plateformes pédagogiques en ligne, et des développeurs d’applications, moyennant paiement ou non, est interdite et constitue une infraction
pénale.

que incluye, a título enunciativo, editoriales, profesores particulares, servicios de apoyo académico o ayuda para el estudio, colegios

                                                                           –3–                                           M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


Subject Details: Biology HL Paper 3 Markscheme

Candidates are required to answer all questions in Section A and all of the questions from one option in Section B. Maximum total = 45 marks.

1.    Each row in the “Question” column relates to the smallest subpart of the question.

2.    The maximum mark for each question subpart is indicated in the “Total” column.

3.    Each marking point in the “Answers” column is shown by means of a semicolon (;) at the end of the marking point.

4.    A question subpart may have more marking points than the total allows. This will be indicated by “max” written after the mark in the “Total” column. The
      related rubric, if necessary, will be outlined in the “Notes” column.

5.    An alternative word is indicated in the “Answers” column by a slash (/). Either word can be accepted.

6.    An alternative answer is indicated in the “Answers” column by “OR”. Either answer can be accepted.

7.    An alternative markscheme is indicated in the “Answers” column under heading ALTERNATIVE 1 etc. Either alternative can be accepted.

8.    Words inside brackets ( ) in the “Answers” column are not necessary to gain the mark.

9.    Words that are underlined are essential for the mark.

10.   The order of marking points does not have to be as in the “Answers” column, unless stated otherwise in the “Notes” column.
                                                                        –4–                                        M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


                                                                     Section A

     Question                                       Answers                                                         Notes                Total
1.     a        2.4 µm                                                                             Allow 2.2 to 2.6µ m
                                                                                                   Accept correct answers in other        1
                                                                                                   SI units e.g. mm/cm
                                                                                                   Units required.

       b        a. cardiac muscle cell has a higher solute concentration/lower water potential
                   than hypotonic solution
                   OR
                   (in osmosis) water moves from a solution with higher water potential to lower
                   water potential                                                                                                        2
                                                                                                   Do not accept “solution moves…”
                   OR
                                                                                                   instead of water moves…”
                   (in osmosis) water moves from lower concentrated solution to higher
                   concentrated solution;
                b. water entering (by osmosis) causes cell to be swollen/enlarged/burst;
                                                                           –5–                                    M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                            Answers                                                  Notes                   Total

2.     a    i    enzyme/substrate/egg white concentration/volume/pH/temperature;                  Accept another reasonable variable.      1

            ii   (with/without) ultrasound pretreatment / time;                                                                            1

       b         a. measure 10 g/parts egg whites;                                                Accept use of volume instead of mass.
                                                                                                                                           2
                 b. add to 90 g/parts of water;

       c         a. more reliable results;                                                        Mp a: do not accept “accurate”.
                 b. to identify outliers/anomalous results
                   OR
                   reduce random errors;                                                                                                  2 max
                 c. assess the variability of the data
                   OR
                   allows statistical tests/calculation of mean/standard deviation/correlation;

       d         it is not, as hydrolysis is higher without ultrasound pretreatment               Do not accept numerical values only
                 OR                                                                               with no attempt to evaluate their
                 it is not, as hydrolysis is lower with ultrasound pretreatment;                  importance.

                                                                                                  Do not accept increase/decrease
                                                                                                  instead of lower/higher.
                                                                                                                                           1
                                                                        –6–                    M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                   Notes                     Total
3.     a        a. temperature;
                b. pH;
                c. minerals / salt concentration / conductivity;                                                          2 max
                d. O2 (concentration);
                e. CO2 (concentration);

       b        environmentally safe/cheaper/control of variables easier;                                                  1

       c        a. photosynthetic organisms/autotrophs/plants as producers;   The question is “outline”, so do not
                b. light (as energy source) for photosynthesis;               accept only a list of variables without a
                                                                              brief account.                              2 max
                c. nutrient/water recycling (by saprotrophs);
                d. decomposers/saprotrophs to breakdown (toxic) wastes;

                                                                        Section B
Option A — Neurobiology and behaviour

      Question                                          Answers                                                    Notes                 Total
 4.     a        The statement seems justified as:                                               Do not accept “connection” instead of
                 a. data shows there are more synapses at an early age                           “synapse”.
                    OR
                   synapses decrease with age;
                 b. more synapses allow for greater learning/cognitive activity;
                                                                                                                                         2 max
                 c. information from the sensory neurons (auditory and visual) used to perform
                    higher order functions (such as learning);
                 d. huge variability at very early age in the number of synapses might mean
                    different children might have differences in learning;
                 e. insufficient information / no standard deviation;

        b        a. neural/synaptic pruning;                                                     Do not accept “connection” instead of
                 b. (neural/synaptic pruning) involves the loss of neurons/dendrites/synapse:    “synapse”.
                                                                                                                                         2 max
                 c. synapses that are not used do not persist;

        c        animal experiments / lesions / fMRI;                                            “f” must be written in fMRI.             1
                                                                        –8–                                     M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M



     Question                                        Answers                                                     Notes                     Total
5.     a        properly labelled chemoreceptor;                                               Accept label with lines pointing directly
                                                                                               to any part of a receptor cell.




                                                                                                                                            1




       b        a. odorants are small/volatile molecules (with different chemical formulae);
                b. olfactory chemoreceptors have receptors (proteins) on surface membrane;                                                 2 max
                c. each odorant attaches to its specific receptor;

       c        a. photoreceptor;                                                              If more than two receptors are written,
                b. proprioceptor/mechanoreceptor;                                              mark only the first two.
                                                                                                                                           2 max
                c. thermoreceptor;
                d. baroreceptor;

     Question                                          Answers                             Notes                 Total
6.     a        a. template/basis of the song is innate (as all have the same base);
                b. (variations) learned from listening to adults;                                               2 max
                c. repeating the songs / learn with experience;

       b        a. template/basis of the song remains the same (as it is innate);
                b. repeated/mimicked song learned from surrounding adults/parent birds;
                c. new variation/tutor song learned by offspring (as typical song is not                        2 max
                   heard)/OWTTE;
                d. learning of variation isn’t perfect/exact;

     Question                                           Answers                                                         Notes                     Total
8.     a    i    a. the longer the migration, the lighter the colour / vice versa;
                 b. too much variation so it is not possible to see a relationship;




                                                                                                                                                  1 max




            ii   a. camouflage to avoid predators (in different migratory routes);
                 b. different diets (in different migratory routes);
                 c. less migratory distance leaves more energy to produce pigments (in plumage);                                                  2 max
                 d. geographic isolation (due to different migratory routes) leads to different gene
                     pools;

       b         a. behavioral variations within the population have a genetic basis;
                 b. selection pressure creates competition;
                 c. individuals that are best adapted to the environment have greater chances of
                    survival;
                                                                                                                                                  3 max
                 d. adapted organisms have greater chances of reproduction/produce more
                    offspring;
                 e. advantageous alleles/behavior is inherited by offspring;
                                                                                                       Do not accept “genes” instead of alleles
                 f. (the frequency of) the favourable alleles/behaviour increases in the population;
                                                                         – 12 –                                      M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M




     Question                                         Answers                                                         Notes                  Total
9.              a. neurotransmitters are (chemicals) released by exocytosis/vesicles (in the pre-
                   synaptic neuron) after the arrival of a nerve impulse;
                b. neurotransmitters leave the presynaptic neuron;
                c. (neurotransmitters) attach to receptors in the postsynaptic neuron;
                d. neurotransmitters (in the synaptic cleft) are broken down/reabsorbed;
                e. fast-acting neurotransmitters attach to protein-ion channels (in postsynaptic     Mp e and f: accept correct named
                   membrane);                                                                        example of fast-acting or slow-acting
                f. slow-acting neurotransmitters activate second messengers (in postsynaptic         neurotransmitters.
                   membrane);
                                                                                                                                             6 max
                g. slow-acting neurotransmitters affect more than one neuron;
                h. some neurotransmitters excite nerve impulses (in postsynaptic neuron) while
                   others inhibit them;
                i. excitatory neurotransmitter causes generation of action potential;                Mp i and j: Accept correct named
                                                                                                     examples of excitatory/inhibitory
                j. inhibitory neurotransmitter prevents threshold being reached (preventing action
                                                                                                     neurotransmitters.
                   potential);
                k. summation of all excitatory / inhibitory neurotransmitters received in
                   postsynaptic neuron;

Option B — Biotechnology and bioinformatics

    Question                                          Answers                                                       Notes                 Total
 10.   a

                                                              batch                 continuous
                   a.    substrate/nutrients added     only at the            all the time;
                                                       beginning
                                                                                                                                         2 max
                   b.    product harvesting            at the end             at periodic intervals
                                                                              / constant;
                   c.    waste removal                 no                     yes;
                   d.    chance of contamination       less                   more;

       b   i    archaeans/methanogenic bacteria/methanogens;                                          Accept named examples.               1

           ii   substrate/reactant / source of nutrients / organic matter for bacteria;


                                                                                                                                           1




       c        a. changes in temperature/heat affect metabolic rate/limit enzyme activity;
                b. production of CO2/carbonic acid decreases pH/increase acidity which denatures
                   enzymes;
                c. high levels of toxins/ammonia/sulphur inhibit growth;                                                                 2 max
                d. increase in salt/organic matter/ethanol concentration can affect osmotic
                   potential/metabolism;
                e. lack of nutrients prevents reproduction / OWTTE;

11.   a      successful as the bands in lanes 4 and 5 are the same size as in lane 2/positive
             control / same size as the gene;

                                                                                                                       1




      b      DNA from non-transformed/normal plant cells because they lack HBsAg
                                                                                                                       1
             gene/OWTTE;
      c      a. kanamycin resistance is used as a marker (gene);
             b. kanamycin kills non-transformed cells;
             c. cells are grown in a plate/medium containing kanamycin;
                                                                                                                     3 max
             d. growth indicates successful uptake (of gene)
               OR
               no growth means no uptake of gene/Ti plasmid;

           b. high biomass density;
           c. low/no cell division;

           d. limited supply of nutrients;
           e. less penetration/diffusion of substances;
           f. emergent properties;

      b    Supports
           a. results show that DPA removed outer layers / reduced EPS (of biofilm);
           b. total surface area reduced after 84 min DPA;
           Does not support                                                                                 2 max
           c. bacteria still present;
           d. it is only a simulation / needs to be investigate experimentally;


      c    no change/slight decrease;                                                                         1

  Question                                       Answers                              Notes                 Total
13.   a      sequencing;



                                                                                                             1




      b      a. karyotyping can only detect large chromosomal rearrangements
               OR
               karyotyping detects at low resolution/down to a million bps;
             b. microarrays can detect whole genome changes in a single assay/array
               OR
                                                                                                             2
               microarrays identify genomic imbalance widely/down to kilobase pairs
               OR
               microarrays use probes to detect genome changes/specific sequences
               OR
               microarrays are quicker/safer/easier;
      c      a. short sequence of cDNA
               OR
               DNA obtained from mRNA (by reverse transcription);
             b. approximately 500 to 800 nucleotides;                                                      2 max
             c. represent (a portion) of expressed genes
               OR
               can be used to identify potential genes;

      b      a. amino acid sequence obtained (in FASTA format);

             c. (sequence alignment) allows comparison of sequences (from different
                organisms)                                                                                                   3 max
                  OR
                  similar sequences are aligned next to each other;
             d. the percentage sequence similarity can be calculated;

15.          a. glyphosate is an herbicide/weed killing substance;                          Allow other viable techniques
             b. tumour-inducing/Ti plasmid as a vector;
             c. glyphosate resistance gene cloned into/added to Ti plasmid;
             d. together with marker gene/antibiotic resistance;
             e. Ti plasmid transformed to/inserted in bacteria/Agrobacterium tumefaciens;
                                                                                                                                 6 max
             f. only antibiotic resistant bacteria selected;
             g. A. tumefaciens infects soybean cells;
             h. transgenic DNA integrated into soybean chromosomes;
             i. glyphosate resistance expressed by soybean;
             j. soybeans not killed when sprayed with glyphosate (only weeds are killed);

Option C — Ecology and conservation

    Question                                         Answers                                                      Notes                 Total
 16.   a        sap beetles are herbivores/primary consumers of strawberry plants which are      Both required.
                                                                                                                                         1
                producers;
       b        a. ripe/semi-ripe have more damage than green;                                   Do not accept values only, unless
                                                                                                 commented.
                b. supports that ripe/semi-ripe emit more chemicals (and attract more beetles)
                  OR
                   supports that green emit less chemicals (and attract less beetles);                                                 2 max
                c. no data on error bars/standard deviation (makes support difficult);
                                                                        – 20 –                                 M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


  Question                                            Answer                                                    Notes                Total

17.   a      colonization of areas that were barren/not previously inhabited/not occupied by
                                                                                                                                      1
             organisms;
      b      a. light limits photosynthesis                                                     Award marks only for factors
                                                                                                accompanied by a description.
               OR
               daylength limits growth season;

             b. (low) temperature limits growth/slows metabolism
               OR
                (low) temperature slows activity of decomposers;                                                                    2 max
             c. (lack of) water due to frozen water/permafrost
               OR
                (lack of) water/rain limits photosynthesis/productivity;
             d. nutrients (in permafrost)/quality/depth of soil limit production of organic
                molecules / OWTTE
               OR
               insufficient soil / permafrost for tree growth;
      c      a. weathering of rock accumulates matter (allowing pioneer species to grow);
             b. decay/decomposition of organisms increase organic matter/detritus/litter;
                                                                                                                                    2 max
             c. increased soil allows larger/more plants to grow / roots preventing erosion;
             d. as more plants are decomposed, soil depth/amount of soil available increases;
                                                                         – 21 –                                      M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


  Question                                           Answers                                                         Notes                 Total
18.   a   i    the higher the DDE concentration, the lower the thickness/higher the thinning         Accept vice versa.
               OR
               negative correlation/inverse relationship;

                                                                                                                                            1




          ii   more risk of predation/ eggs break more easily/fewer chicks hatch;                    OWTTE                                  1

      b        a. California, as most eggs have a high level of DDE / most eggshells are thinning;
               b. (California as) less chicks hatching (results in smaller population size)
                 OR                                                                                                                         2
                 (California as) birth rate less than death rate (so decrease in population);



      c        a. DDE accumulates in (fat tissues of) organisms/bioaccumulation;
               b. (brown) pelicans/birds feed on fish/organisms (that have accumulated DDE);
               c. (DDE) is not excreted;                                                                                                  3 max
               d. (DDE) concentration increases as trophic level increases;
               e. (brown) pelicans are in a high trophic level (so have a high accumulation);

             c. (intraspecific) competition slows growth rate;
             d. carrying capacity has been reached/stabilized;
             e. intoxication from excretion limits growth;                                                             3 max

  Question                                            Answers                        Notes                 Total
20.   a      a. excess nutrients/eutrophication;
             b. excessive growth of algae/algal blooms;
             c. blocking of sun prevents photosynthesis;
                                                                                                          3 max
             d. increased decomposition of algae/organisms;
             e. increased biochemical oxygen demand/BOD;
             f. other organisms/fish die due to lack of oxygen;

      b      the higher the elevation, the greater the nitrogen content
             OR
             positive relationship;
                                                                                                            1




      c      a. pitcher plants consume more insects (at different sampling sites);
             b. larger insects contain more nitrogen;
             c. more nitrogen concentration in soil
               OR
               more nitrifying bacteria in the soil
               OR                                                                                         2 max
               water-logged soil has less nitrogen;
             d. use of N/NPK fertilizers
               OR
                leaching of N in different sites;
             e. more litter at different sites;
                                                                        – 24 –                                    M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


  Question                                          Answers                                                       Notes                     Total
21.          a. biogeographic features are combinations of species, habitats and physical
                features;
             b. richness is the number of different species present (in an area);
             c. evenness refers to relative abundance of the different species (in an area) /
                OWTTE;
             d. large nature reserves/large islands (potentially) have greater biodiversity /
                richness / evenness;
             e. large areas (tend to) have more species/populations/habitats/richness
               OR
               large areas have more stability/higher biodiversity index
               OR
               have less chances of loss of a species;
             f. connected areas/nature reserves have more diversity than isolated ones                                                      6 max
               OR
               corridors between (small) areas/ reserves increases richness/biodiversity;
             g. the greater the surface:perimeter ratio, the greater the biodiversity;
             h. edges are transition areas
                OR
                have greater richness/lower evenness
                OR
                are less stable;
             i. circular shape has more biodiversity than rectangular shape;
             j. biodiversity measured by Simpson’s / diversity index;
             k. one additional abiotic factor affecting biodiversity;
                                                                                                e.g. precipitation, soil quality/content,
                                                                                                temperature, etc.
                                                                          – 25 –                                M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


Option D — Human physiology

   Question                                            Answers                                                  Notes                 Total
 22.   a   i    (relatively) low risk as a few/5% have vit C below RDA;                                                                1

           ii   high risk, as many/90% have low intake of iron;                                                                        1

       b   i    a. constipation
                  OR
                   slow intestinal transport/transit;                                                                                1 max
                b. increased chances of diabetes/cancer/hemorrhoids/appendicitis/obesity;
                c. higher blood glycemic index;

           ii   low bone mineralization/rickets/osteomalacia/osteoporosis;                                                             1

       c        a. essential fatty acids missing;                                           Accept the definition or an example of
                b. not enough energy/calories (for organs);                                 essential fatty acid instead.

                c. not enough phospholipids (for cell membrane production);                 Reject insulation

                d. not enough myelin for neurons;
                                                                                                                                     1 max
                e. not enough steroid/named steroid hormone produced;
                f. low levels/absorption of fat-soluble vitamins;                           No mark if the named hormone is not a
                                                                                            steroid.
                g. insufficient HDL/LDL/cholesterol;
                                                                       – 26 –                                          M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


  Question                                           Answers                                                           Notes                        Total
23.   a      a. controlled by nervous and hormonal mechanisms;                                       Accept details to that effect, e.g. gastrin.
             b. hydrochloric acid is secreted;
             c. secreted by parietal cells/stomach wall/lining;                                                                                     2 max
             d. achieved by a proton pump / H -K ATPase;
                                                 +   +


             e. H+ from the cytoplasm exchanged for K+ in lumen;

      b      a. proton pump inhibitors (PPI) used;
             b. PPIs activated by acid;
             c. PPIs bind irreversibly to pump                                                                                                      2 max
               OR
               prevent stomach cells from pumping acid into stomach;

      c      a. drugs/PPI will decrease risk of duodenal cancer as acid production will
                decrease;
             b. drugs/PPIs will increase/not affect risk of gastric cancer as it is related to low
                acid production;                                                                                                                    1 max
             c. antibiotics will decrease risk of duodenal cancer as they kill H. pylori, thus
                reduce acid production;
                                                                     – 27 –                                      M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


  Question                                        Answers                                                        Notes                     Total
24.          a. raised blood pressure damages arteries/coronary/cerebral blood vessels          If more than two factors written, mark
                (manifesting as heart attacks and strokes);                                     only the first two descriptions.
             b. smoking tobacco causes greater platelet aggregation (increases risk of          Award only if descriptions are included.
                thrombosis/CHD due to atherosclerosis)
                  OR
                  smoking tobacco lowers oxygen supply / greater oxygen demand (so heart
                  works more)
                  OR
                  nicotine (in smoking tobacco) causes vasoconstriction/raises blood pressure
                  (that can damage arteries);                                                                                              2 max
             c. high glucose causes stronger contraction of blood vessels/raised blood
                pressure (causing damage to arteries/ coronary/cerebral blood vessels);
             d. physical inactivity prevents return of venous blood from the extremities;
             e. overweight and obesity causes greater risk of clot/plaque formation
                  OR
                  overweight and obesity raises blood pressure/vasoconstriction;
             f.   high cholesterol promotes plaque formation/blockage of arteries (which
                  increases risk of thrombosis/CHD due to atherosclerosis);
                                                                     – 28 –        M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


  Question                                        Answers                          Notes                 Total
25.   a      a. nursing/suckling stimulates prolactin production
                OR
                (prolactin production) starts to increase during breast feeding;
             b. prolactin produced by the anterior pituitary;                                           2 max

             c. regulated by hypothalamus / estrogen;
             d. prolactin promotes milk production (by mammary glands);

      b      oxytocin;                                                                                    1
                                                                     – 29 –                  M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


  Question                                        Answers                                    Notes                 Total
26.   a      a. oxygen binds to hemoglobin;
             b. oxygen is bound to iron/heme;
             c. carbon dioxide is carried bound to hemoglobin/as carboxyhemoglobin (in red
                                                                                                                  3 max
                blood cells);
             d. carbon dioxide is transformed (in red blood cells) into hydrogen carbonate
                ions;

      b      a. less oxygen/lower pO2 in the air at high altitude;
             b. difficult for hemoglobin to become saturated;
             c.   (low oxygen) necessitates more hemoglobin;                                                      3 max
             d. increase in red blood cell production increases total hemoglobin;
             e. more hemoglobin can transport more oxygen;

      c      a. phagocytosis/engulfed (of red blood cells) by Kupffer cells/macrophages;
             b. hemoglobin split into globin and heme group;
                                                                                                                  3 max
             c.   amino acids (from the globin) recycled;
             d. heme group broken down into iron and bilirubin;
                                                                       – 30 –                                      M23/4/BIOLO/HP3/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


  Question                                          Answers                                                         Notes                Total
27.          Adaptations for absorption:                                                            Allow maximum of 5 marks
             a. epithelial cells are one cell layer thick which facilitates transport (from the     for absorption.
                lumen to blood vessels);
             b. (epithelial cells) joined by tight junctions prevents leakage/OWTTE;
             c.   (each cell has) microvilli/brush border to increase absorption surface
                  OR
                  microvilli provide large surface area:volume ratio to increase absorption rate;
             d. epithelial cells close to capillaries for transport/OWTTE;
             e. epithelial cells rich in mitochondria to provide energy/ATP (for active
                transport);
             f.   membranes contain protein channels used for co-transport/facilitated diffusion                                        6 max
                  of substances;
             g. vesicles in large numbers for absorption of larger molecules (by endocytosis);      Accept correct examples.


                  Storage in liver:
             h. glucose is stored as glycogen (in the liver/hepatocytes);
             i.   fatty acids/fats stored in hepatocytes;                                           Accept correct examples.
             j.   excess Vitamin A/D stored in hepatocytes;
             k.   iron/minerals stored in hepatocytes;
             l.   detoxification/breakdown of toxins;
